experience: You and Donna both know Shay Pausa, David Stark, and 26 others

* Utilize DFP and other tools to check incoming tags from clients.  * Created simple testing tool using Javascript that was meant to live in a Sharepoint site.  * Created a script in javascript to parse an XML file and prepare it to be saved as an Excel spreadsheet. This tool would allow me to more easily match up what was marked as sold in our sales management program and the tags that came in from clients. * Built myself a simple task management system in Sharepoint. Included uploading files, added version management to the files with email notification on changes, auto-generated tasks when new files were added. Also had custom tasks for pre-checking landing page takeovers that included saving the links of the live DFP line items, the test DFP line items and the actual test links. * Nightly checked landing pages that had takeovers. Desktop, tablet and mobile versions. If there were issues, I would fix them. If I couldn't, I would contact my on-call person. Sent emails nightly at the end to indicate any issues or lack-thereof. * Sent emails each morning, coordinating with two teams in order to make sure the landing pages for that night were ready and noted in Basecamp. * Built a lot of my processes. This position had not existed at SheKnows prior to 2015.

* Created custom ad tags using Flite.com * Built myself a task tracking application leveraging PHP's Symfony framework, CSS's Bootstrap framework and jQuery. This system worked outside of Basecamp, but included links to DFP and Basecamp so that I could easily navigate my way around. Because it was in mySQL, I could setup whatever queries I wanted to pull. * Used XML, HTML and CSS to ensure content updates that have been sold are published to our live website.  * Implemented any ad tag optimizations in order to make sure the correct content is roadblocked by the correct client.

Converted Photoshop files to WordPress’s blog templates for SheKnows.com/blogs/.Working within the current framework of PointsAndPrizes.com to assist in updating the site; troubleshooting and fixing problems and in some cases, rewriting various functions to work in the new framework.Created a fully dynamic contest system for use with both PointsandPrizes.com and SheKnows.com.
Provided customer support for our internet access customers, revamped and streamlined the process for getting customers on and off our service.

I learned how to build web applications using Microsoft’s ASP.NET framework and AngularJS. This program gave me the opportunity to learn how to program using C#, build database-driven Web applications using ASP.NET MVC and the Entity Framework, and create richly interactive client-side apps using the JavaScript AngularJS library.

Director of Technology  at Everyday Dishes & General Manager at Myria Publishing, LLC

I've worked with Patti for 5 years - over that time, we worked together as Front End Developers on SheKnows.com and some of it's owned sites. I've also reported to Patti. She's managed developers, designer, traffickers and project managers - most all at the same time. She implemented various processes to help make teams efficient - even when the teams were under-staffed. She is a very responsible woman, who very quickly owns any project given her. She learns quickly and can very easily grasp new concepts. It has been a joy to work with Patti.

summary: I like learning new things - new crafts, new technologies. I’ve taught myself HTML, CSS, Javascript, PHP and a little MySQL. I did have the opportunity to attend a programming boot-camp where I opted to learn Full-stack ASP.Net. During the boot-camp, I worked on a personal project for one of my role play groups - I got started building them a token / rewards shop so our players could get rewards for their various in-character achievements. Our group project was the start of site to build a community and support network for working mothers. We called it "WoMoCo - Working Mothers Connection". It was an interesting project and rather exciting. All six of us on the project had varying degrees of programming experience. I had fun not only trying out the new technologies, but helping my teammates troubleshoot and come up with new ways of looking at problems they were having.
name: Donna Ryan (Ehmke)
title: Full Stack Web Developer
